channel.title: Pictures n' shit
channel.description:
I got a new camera recently, so that means I'm an amazing photographer and have amazing artistic sense, right?
[img]http://fc07.deviantart.com/fs31/i/2008/188/1/6/Rainbow_Flower_by_J0nny0000.png[/img] http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Rainbow-Flower-90868869 http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Purple-Flowers-90784863 http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Evening-Horizons-90783967
Edit: MOAR http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Evening-Wind-90882010 http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Grassy-Field-90881730
What do you think?

item.title: Pictures n' shit
item.dc:creator: @Frostie21 Frostie21
item.description:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:29, topic:217948”][quote author=goatee link=topic=286425.msg2322691#msg2322691 date=1215566589]

Wow you freak out because of like 3 posts that I make after quoting you. I don’t have a problem with you. It is that you are turning into goatee who is an ass. He has like 3 good posts and 500 shit ones.

Thanks for bringing me into this… and btw what happened to the other 3034 posts i have?

Good to see that even why I don’t post for a while people still cry about my horrible posts. Go fuck yourself.
[/quote]

I don’t see how your posts are bad. They’re just as bad as mine. I still don’t understand why everyone says I’m turning into you. I’ve been here longer than you. And only by a little. They can go back and look at my old posts and see I’m the same way I am now, as I was then.[/quote]

You have been posting more?

Read full topic

item.title: Pictures n' shit
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:22, topic:217948”]Well I know a lot about photography…

I think this is your best:
http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Evening-Wind-90882010
There’s a few reasons why. The rule of thirds is used in several ways. When your subject is in the dead center, it tends to be boring. Notice how the wind turbines are to the right third of the picture… And also the same is with your horizon. When the horizon is in the dead center, it’s just less flattering and doesn’t look as good. In this picture your horizon is in the lower third. This puts great emphasis on the sky and gives it a sense of freedom. This would be better if you had some more clouds, especially dramatic clouds. I’m only into black and white photography though, so even without clouds it does look nice being able to see the gradients of color in the sky. The sun is also in the left third. Typically you want to avoid lens flare but if it’s on purpose you can have some nice effects from it. I see a lot of elements and principles of design, and your composition is great. Now there kind of is a problem with exposure with it, but the silhouette does good with this imo. Because the sun is infront of you, it will trick your cameras light meter into thinking there is more light then what there really is. If you wanted to show your wind turbines and the landscape instead of the silhouette, you would need to let in more light. I don’t know if you have a manual camera though.

There’s a million rules you can follow in photography though, and the best pictures are usually the ones that break the rules.

But yeah all of these are basically snapshots. If your school offers photography courses, you should take them.[/quote]
Thanks for the tips, I appreciate it. I can change all the settings on my camera, there is a “manual” mode which lets you set the aperture and stuff, but I never really took the time to learn how to use it properly. I’ll look into that a bit more. As for the lens flare, it wasn’t really intentional nor unintentional, but I think it looks rather nice. If there were clouds, they would be in the picture, but there were absolutely none to be seen in the sky.
Thanks again for the tips and ideas

Read full topic

@wow_raped_XD wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

That wasn’t C&C, that was you kissing the ass of who you thought was an important figure in the community. And then focusing your ass kissing on someone else. When you give C&C, you give Constructive Criticism. Something constructive, not useless, and annoying. You must remain adamant when it comes to the C&C you give. Changing it constantly will make people think you’re not sure of your decision. And won’t take it to heart.

True, meh i should just shut up =/

item.title: Pictures n' shit
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Well I know a lot about photography…

I think this is your best:
http://j0nny0000.deviantart.com/art/Evening-Wind-90882010
There’s a few reasons why. The rule of thirds is used in several ways. When your subject is in the dead center, it tends to be boring. Notice how the wind turbines are to the right third of the picture… And also the same is with your horizon. When the horizon is in the dead center, it’s just less flattering and doesn’t look as good. In this picture your horizon is in the lower third. This puts great emphasis on the sky and gives it a sense of freedom. This would be better if you had some more clouds, especially dramatic clouds. I’m only into black and white photography though, so even without clouds it does look nice being able to see the gradients of color in the sky. The sun is also in the left third. Typically you want to avoid lens flare but if it’s on purpose you can have some nice effects from it. I see a lot of elements and principles of design, and your composition is great. Now there kind of is a problem with exposure with it, but the silhouette does good with this imo. Because the sun is infront of you, it will trick your cameras light meter into thinking there is more light then what there really is. If you wanted to show your wind turbines and the landscape instead of the silhouette, you would need to let in more light. I don’t know if you have a manual camera though.

There’s a million rules you can follow in photography though, and the best pictures are usually the ones that break the rules.

But yeah all of these are basically snapshots. If your school offers photography courses, you should take them.

item.title: Pictures n' shit
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:12, topic:217948”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=286425.msg2319019#msg2319019 date=1215420653]

Mmk…?

You used an effect in PhotoShop on some amateur photos you took. Nice.

Better then you lol (even though your right)

For one thing, you’ve never seen my work. Second, that wasn’t funny at all. If you have some personal issue with me. Take it up in Private Message, but don’t try and deface my credibility. I may not have treated Unhandled kindly with his work. But for you to take up your personal issues with me in every topic I post in, isn’t how you should go about this. I would be happy to discuss with you any issues you have with me. In PM.
[/quote]

Wow you freak out because of like 3 posts that I make after quoting you. I don’t have a problem with you. It is that you are turning into goatee who is an ass. He has like 3 good posts and 500 shit ones.

BTW back on topic

Some of the pictures look bad. Like the quality on them is pretty horrible.

wow, you now get the rape award at raping at photography, seriously, your really good.

He is not that good. He took some random photos and edited one of them in photoshop. It is not that amazing…[/quote]

I do not understand why everyone says I am turning into someone else. I have always been the way I am now. And you can check my posts to find proof. I’ve been here just as long as goatee, give or take 2 days. I’m almost sure. So I am not influenced by any single person. I am my own person, with my own personality. I didn’t freak out, but I like to settle things in private. Rather than make a public spectacle of it. Especially since this topic is about Unhandled’s work.
